meanings.definition: Trouble or difficulty caused by something that is unexpected or unwelcome.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected delay at the airport was a big inconvenience for the travelers.
meanings.sent2: Carrying heavy bags while shopping can be quite an inconvenience.
meanings.sent3: It was an inconvenience when the power went out during the movie, but we made the best of it.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden illness was an inconvenience, throwing a wrench in our plans.
meanings.sent5: The flat tire on the way to work was an inconvenience that made him late.

meanings.definition: To cause trouble or difficulty to someone.
meanings.sent1: Please don't inconvenience yourself by going out of your way to help me.
meanings.sent2: The road closure inconvenienced many commuters during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: He inconvenienced his friends by arriving late to the party.
meanings.sent4: The broken elevator inconvenienced the residents of the building for days.
meanings.sent5: The construction noise inconvenienced the entire neighborhood for weeks.
